question:
Which of the following is / are permanent houses?
  1. Legislative Council
  2. Upper House of Parliament
  3. Municipal Council
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Legislative Council Legislative council is the upper house of the state legislature in India. These are permanent houses as every two years, one-third of the total number of members \"retire\" in rotation and the house is not dissolved. Upper House of Parliament Rajya Sabha is also a permanent house and is never dissolved. Its 2/3rd members retire every two years. Municipal Council Municipal Councils are not permanent. They are constituted after local body elections.
